title: Public banned from Kachchatheevu festival
content: In the light of disputes among fishermen of Tamil Nadu and the Northern Province, Minister of Fisheries Douglas Devananda said that no devotees from either Sri Lanka or Tamil Nadu would be allowed to attend the Kachchatheevu St. Anthonyâ€™s Church festival on 11 and 12 March.He said on Thursday (17) the decision was announced by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa at a recent meeting. He said the priest would conduct the mass during the festival sans the public attending the event.The festival was not held in the past two years due to the Covid situation, likewise, this year too, the Government decided to not let the public attend the church mass, he added.Earlier, Tamil Nadu Government requested Minister Devananda to issue permission for its fishermen and their families to attend the festival to which the minister was planning to approve. However, Sri Lankan Government decided not to issue permission.
